workflowInfo.workflowDescription: Sample demonstrating the use of automated steps in workflow.

variable.name: st_user
variable.label: user ID
variable.abstract: User ID for the started task.
variable.description: The user ID under whose authority the new started task will run.

variable.name: st_group
variable.label: group
variable.abstract: Group name for the started task.
variable.description: The group name under whose authority the started task will run.

variable.name: st_gid
variable.label: GID
variable.description: The UNIX group ID (GID) to be associated with the started task group.

step.name: simpleAutomatableStep
step.title: Simple automatable step
step.description: This sample shows a very basic workflow automatable step.
step.instructions: Use the Instructions area to describe in detail what the user needs to do to complete the step. On completion of the step, the user should press Finish to have the step marked complete in the Workflows task. This step can be performed automatically.

step.name: subStep2
step.title: Second-level step 2
step.instructions: This step depends on the previous Third-level step.

step.name: nonAutomatedStep
step.title: Non-automated Step
step.description: This is a sample of non-automated step.
step.instructions: This is a simple sample to demonstrate steps that can not be performed automatically.

step.name: submitEmptyJCL
step.title: Submit an empty JCL job
step.description: Submit an empy JCL job to JES using IEFBR14.
step.instructions: This is a very simple JCL job submittion test using IEFBR14 and nothing will be done here.

step.name: verifyUserID
step.title: Verify the UID of the user using a shell script
step.description: In this step, you verify the UID of the user. This step involves running an in-line shell script.
step.instructions: In this example step, you enter a RACF command through an in-line shell script to verify the UNIX definitions. The output is written to the STDOUT DD of the submitted job.

template.inlineTemplate: # shell script to issue 'id' command against defined user id $instance-st_user

step.name: defineRACFGroup
step.title: Define the RACF group using a JCL job
step.description: In this step, you define the RACF group. This step involves submitting a JCL job.
step.instructions:
In this example step, you enter a RACF command through a JCL job.
You will have the option to save a copy of the JCL after you have reviewed it for your approval.
